column1: #Text=is on the Wirral Peninsula in Merseyside .
#Text=is an idyllic seaside town overlooking the Irish Sea with views of Wales , Hilbre Island and Liverpool .
#Text=It has been ranked a top global tourist destination .
#Text=International tourism booms during major golf tournaments at the Royal Liverpool Golf Club .
#Text=Tiger Woods is one of many celebrities who have popularised the town .
#Text=The award winning Hoylake branch of Home Bargains has become a must visit location in the past decade after achieving a cult status .
#Text=Situated on Market Street , the towns central road , it has been catching attention and has gained a growing fan base .
#Text=West Kirby is a small , Edwardian seaside town at the mouth of the Dee estuary .
#Text=It offers a pleasant beach , views across to North Wales and Hilbre Island , as well as Coronation Gardens and a rare marine lake walk .
#Text=Caldy , Thurstaston , Hoylake and Meols are adjacent villages along the coast .
#Text=A5027 and B5192 from the M53 motorway , junction 2a
#Text=( about 40 minutes walk from the noticeboard , adjacent to the Wirral Sailing Centre , at the end of Dee Lane in West Kirby ) .
#Text=The island group consists of Hilbre itself , Middle Eye and Little Eye .
#Text=Walk out to Hilbre or its smaller ( and closer ) outcrop , Little Eye ( be VERY careful of tides - read guidance on signs near the boathouse , at northern end of the marine lake ) .
#Text=A raincoat and wellies or sturdy , waterproof walking boots are recommended for the walk across .

#Text=To get to the island accepted wisdom is , when the tide is on the ebb to walk from West Kirby from the northern end of the Marine Lake to Little Eye first and then around the " back " of Middle Eye avoiding what can be impassable gullies to the " front " of the islands , and thence to Hilbre itself .
#Text=Crossing when unsure of the tides can mean , at best , being isolated on the islands until the tide ebbs , or at worst , the risk of being caught between fast flowing tidal gullies .
#Text=The walker should not be tempted to walk direct to Hilbre from " Red Rocks " at the end of Stanley Rd Hoylake .
#Text=The marine lake can be viewed from the lengthy promenade , which has parking , plus benches to enjoy the often busy sailing activity .
#Text=There is also a walkway around the marine lake , which provides very good views of the summer sunset .

#Text=The Old Village is quite pretty ; visit St. Bridget 's church , maybe walk through Ashton Park , which straddles the Wirral Way , itself a lengthy stroll along the bed of an old rail branchline , with fine views .
#Text=, Westbourne Rd , CH48 4DH ( about 10 minutes walk from West Kirby Station ) .
#Text=The most northerly point of the Wirral Way . free .
#Text=( Thurstaston Visitor Centre ) , Station Road , Thurstaston . CH61 0HN ( The 22 ( and 22a ) bus routes run to Wirral Country Park , Thurstaston from Chester via Willaston , Neston and Heswall .
#Text=The Wirral Way can be accessed from Hooton railway station , where there is a gate on top of the bridge crossing the railway track .
#Text=This is now the start of the Wirral Way , at this end , as it was extended from Hadlow Road to make it easier to access by train from Liverpool via the Merseyrail system .
#Text=The Wirral Way is very popular with pedestrians , dog walkers , horse riders and cyclists . ) .
#Text=Wirral Country Park features a 12 mile footpath following the line of the old West Kirby to Hooton railway line , offering superb views over the Dee Estuary to Wales .
#Text=Today it is a must for a family day out and it 's facilities include the Visitor Centre , Bird Hide , Toilets , Picnic Areas , BBQ area , Café , and Green Shop .
#Text=The Green Shop contains an information and sales desk where you can pick up leaflets , guides , books of special interest and information .
#Text=Staff will be happy to assist you .
#Text=You can access the beautiful beach from the bottom of Station Road or Tinkers Dell Steps .
#Text=Walk , run , cycle or horse ride the Wirral Way .
#Text=Cycle to Liverpool along the coast path .
#Text=Idle in one of many independent cafes .
#Text=Take in the sunset , alongside the marine lake .
#Text=, St Bridget 's Centre , St Bridget 's Lane , CH48 3JT , ☏ +44771 610-0131 .
#Text=Visit the museum to see the collection of stone artefacts , dating from 900AD onwards .
#Text=( The Concourse ) , Grange Road , CH48 4HX ( 1 minute walk from West Kirby Station ) .
#Text=( JD Wetherspoons ) , 44 Grange Road , CH48 4EF ( Opposite the Concourse and railway station ) , ☏ +44151 929-6300 .
#Text=Actually better than it used to be , when it was a ' real ' pub !
#Text=The pub is quite small but friendly & interesting .
#Text=( JD Wetherspoons ) , 52 – 54 Market Street , Hoylake . CH47 3BB ( 10 minutes from Hoylake station ) , ☏ +44151 632-1209 .
#Text=, 338 Telegraph Road , Thurstaston , Wirral . CH61 0HJ ( On the A540 , near the Thurstaston and Irby roundabout . ) , ☏ +44151 648-2837 .
